elements.title: Systematic analyses of lipid mobilization by human lipid transfer proteins
elements.contents:

elements.title: A hidden diversity of ceratopsian dinosaurs in Late Cretaceous Europe
elements.contents:
A hidden diversity of ceratopsian dinosaurs in Late Cretaceous Europe

New results indicate that rhabdodontids and the previously described Ajkaceratops are actually distinctive European ceratopsians, a group better known from Asia and North America.

  • Susannah C. R. Maidment
  • Richard J. Butler
  • Attila Ősi
Article07 Jan 2026

elements.title: A young progenitor for the most common planetary systems in the Galaxy
elements.contents:
A young progenitor for the most common planetary systems in the Galaxy

A nine-year transit-timing campaign has measured the extremely low masses and densities of four large planets orbiting the young star V1298 Tau, which are now predicted to contract and form a typical compact super-Earth and sub-Neptune system.

  • John H. Livingston
  • Erik A. Petigura
  • Lorenzo Pino
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Surface optimization governs the local design of physical networks
elements.contents:
Surface optimization governs the local design of physical networks

Analysis of the local branching geometries of several physical networks shows violations of predictions of length and volume minimization, leading to the hypothesis that estimating the material cost requires accounting for the full three-dimensional geometry.

  • Xiangyi Meng
  • Benjamin Piazza
  • Albert-László Barabási
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026

elements.title: RNA-triggered Cas12a3 cleaves tRNA tails to execute bacterial immunity
elements.contents:
RNA-triggered Cas12a3 cleaves tRNA tails to execute bacterial immunity

Cas12a3 nucleases constitute a distinct clade of type V CRISPR–Cas bacterial immune systems that preferentially cleave the 3′ tails of tRNAs after recognition of target RNA to induce growth arrest and block phage dissemination.

  • Oleg Dmytrenko
  • Biao Yuan
  • Chase L. Beisel
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Plastic landmark anchoring in zebrafish compass neurons
elements.contents:
Plastic landmark anchoring in zebrafish compass neurons

Using two-photon microscopy with a panoramic virtual reality setup, how head direction cells in larval zebrafish integrate visual landmarks and optic flow to track orientation is revealed.

  • Ryosuke Tanaka
  • Ruben Portugues
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026

elements.title: An expanded registry of candidate cis-regulatory elements
elements.contents:
An expanded registry of candidate cis-regulatory elements

The existing ENCODE registry of candidate human and mouse cis-regulatory elements is expanded with the addition of new ENCODE data, integrating new functional data as well as new cell and tissue types.

  • Jill E. Moore
  • Henry E. Pratt
  • Zhiping Weng
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026

elements.title: High-voltage anode-free sodium–sulfur batteries
elements.contents:
High-voltage anode-free sodium–sulfur batteries

A new architecture based on high-valence sulfur/sulfur tetrachloride cathode chemistry is described for manufacturing high-voltage anode-free sodium–sulfur batteries, demonstrating promise for applications in grid energy storage and wearable electronics.

  • Shitao Geng
  • Bin Yuan
  • Hao Sun
Article07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Climate change shifts the North Pacific storm track polewards
elements.contents:
Climate change shifts the North Pacific storm track polewards

An observation-based storm-track proxy shows that the winter North Pacific storm track has shifted substantially polewards, suggesting regional impacts on precipitation and warming patterns, with implications for temperature variability and extreme events.

  • Rei Chemke
  • Janni Yuval
Article07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Prefrontal neural geometry of learned cues guides motivated behaviours
elements.contents:
Prefrontal neural geometry of learned cues guides motivated behaviours

The dorsomedial prefrontal cortex encodes the value, salience and valence of learned stimuli along distinct neural dimensions, and the geometry of these representations shapes motivated behaviours in mice.

  • Nanci Winke
  • Andreas Lüthi
  • Daniel Jercog
Article07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Bidirectional CRISPR screens decode a GLIS3-dependent fibrotic cell circuit
elements.contents:
Bidirectional CRISPR screens decode a GLIS3-dependent fibrotic cell circuit

Integrated single-cell and spatial data analysis, combined with bidirectional CRISPR screens, identify the transcription factor GLIS3 as a key driver of chronic inflammation and fibrosis and a potential marker of disease severity in patients with ulcerative colitis.

  • Vladislav Pokatayev
  • Alok Jaiswal
  • Ramnik J. Xavier
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Soft biodegradable implants for long-distance and wide-angle sensing
elements.contents:
Soft biodegradable implants for long-distance and wide-angle sensing

A soft, biodegradable, wireless sensing device can monitor pressure, temperature and strain over long distances (up to 16 cm), maintaining accuracy across varying positions and angles.

  • Yuqun Lan
  • Shuang Li
  • Yewang Su
Article07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Early hominins from Morocco basal to the Homo sapiens lineage
elements.contents:
Early hominins from Morocco basal to the Homo sapiens lineage

New hominin fossils from the Grotte à Hominidés at Thomas Quarry I (ThI-GH) in Casablanca, Morocco, dated to around 773 thousand years ago are similar in age to Homo antecessor, yet are morphologically distinct.

  • Jean-Jacques Hublin
  • David Lefèvre
  • Abderrahim Mohib
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Genetic switch between unicellularity and multicellularity in marine yeasts
elements.contents:
Genetic switch between unicellularity and multicellularity in marine yeasts

Myb1 functions as a switch-like regulator of state transitions in Hortaea werneckii, whereby its expression and degradation are coupled to nutrient conditions, stabilizing unicellular or multicellular growth.

  • Gakuho Kurita
  • Kyoka A. Adachi
  • Gohta Goshima
Article07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Insights into DNA repeat expansions among 900,000 biobank participants
elements.contents:
Insights into DNA repeat expansions among 900,000 biobank participants

Human genetic variation influences instability of DNA repeats that commonly expand as we age.

  • Margaux L. A. Hujoel
  • Robert E. Handsaker
  • Po-Ru Loh
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Pulse heating and slip enhance charging of phase-change thermal batteries
elements.contents:
Pulse heating and slip enhance charging of phase-change thermal batteries

A strategy based on the design of a composite coating that enables slip-enhanced close-contact melting inside sealed phase-change thermal batteries to improve charging rates enables high-performance thermal energy storage over a wide range of temperatures.

  • Zi-Rui Li
  • Nan Hu
  • Li-Wu Fan
Article07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Neuro-epithelial circuits promote sensory convergence and intestinal immunity
elements.contents:
Neuro-epithelial circuits promote sensory convergence and intestinal immunity

Specific pain-sensing nociceptors and chemosensory tuft cells form a circuit to promote type 2 immune responses in the intestine.

  • Wen Zhang
  • Elizabeth R. Emanuel
  • David Artis
Article07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Nutrient requirements of organ-specific metastasis in breast cancer
elements.contents:
Nutrient requirements of organ-specific metastasis in breast cancer

How the complex interplay between multiple nutrients within the microenvironment dictates potential sites of metastatic cancer growth is explored.

  • Keene L. Abbott
  • Sonu Subudhi
  • Matthew G. Vander Heiden
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026

elements.title: Towards fibre-like loss for photonic integration from violet to near-infrared
elements.contents:
Towards fibre-like loss for photonic integration from violet to near-infrared

Germano-silicate used as a building material for integrated photonics circuits substantially reduces optical losses, approaching levels comparable to those in optical fibres.

  • Hao-Jing Chen
  • Kellan Colburn
  • Kerry Vahala
ArticleOpen Access07 Jan 2026
